newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton output reaches 6.804 mln bales.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton output reaches 6.804 mln bales.

text.p: The state-run Cotton Export Corporation of Pakistan said on Saturday cotton output in the 1996/97 (July-June) crop year had reached a provisional 6.804 million 375-lb bales by December 19, down from 6.922 million bales a year earlier.
It said textile mills had bought 4.996 million bales, up from 4.699 million bales in the year-ago period, while exporters had picked up only 2,000, against 551,800 bales last year.
A total of 1.805 million unsold bales were stocked at ginning factories, compared to 1.671 million a year ago, the Corporation said.
Officials estimate production of nearly nine million bales from the whole pest-damaged 1996/97 crop, down from earlier estimates of 10 million and last year's production of 9.96 million.
